== Ubuntu-AU Re-Approval ==

=== Key Details ===
* '''Date''' - 11th June, 2011
* '''Team Contact''' - JaredNorris 
* '''Membership''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-au/+members#active|248]]</nowiki> as of 11 June 2011
* '''Mailing List''' - <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-au|ubuntu-au]]</nowiki> on lists.ubuntu.com with 314 subscribers and 4 moderators
* '''IRC''' - #ubuntu-au on freenode for on-topic support/discussion, #ubuntu-au-chat for casual chatter
* '''<nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.org.au/|Website]]</nowiki>''' - RT submitted to update to allow us to freshen the theme (RT# 16894)
* '''<nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/teams/ubuntu-au|Team Loco.U.C Page]]</nowiki>
* '''<nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=399|Loco Forum]]</nowiki>''' - new team forum added this year
* '''<nowiki>[[http://planet.ubuntu.org.au/|Ubuntu-AU Planet]]</nowiki>'''
* '''Social Media'''
** <nowiki>[[http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=4323588812|Ubuntu-AU Facebook Account]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://identi.ca/ubuntuau|Ubuntu-AU Identica Account]]</nowiki> - '''NEW'''
** <nowiki>[[https://twitter.com/#!/UbuntuAU|Ubuntu-AU Twitter Account]]</nowiki> - '''NEW'''

=== Relevant resources ===
* '''Local CD Distribution''' - http://ubuntu.net.au/ (Since 2006)

=== Roadmap ===

Here you should provide a list of things you plan on doing. Include links to where these are discussed online and on mailing lists.

==== 2011 Planned activities ====
===== Confs/Expos =====
* Software Freedom Day Saturday 17th September 2011 - Events in several cities around the country would be an achievable goal - see http://www.softwarefreedomday.org/ for more information
* Education expo and OpenCeBIT are coming up too.

===== Social =====
* Release parties for new releases
* Several people have been discussing ideas for holding <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Hour|Ubuntu Hours]]</nowiki>

===== Other Team Related =====
* Joining in the Ubuntu Global Jam planned for September
* Localisation: aiming for 90%+ translation for the en-AU team by the next LTS release - Ubuntu 12.04

=== Experience ===

==== 2011 ====
===== Confs/Expos =====
* 2011-01-29 - Heaps of team members and other Canonical ring-ins helped put together a great showing at <nowiki>[[http://lca2011.linux.org.au|linux.conf.au]]</nowiki>. Detailed reports and pictures available at the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AustralianTeam/LCA2011Brisbane|LCA2011 Brisbane organisation wiki page]]</nowiki>.
<nowiki>[[File:LCA2011.jpg|A collage of faces at LCA2011 in Brisbane]]</nowiki>
* 2011-03-10 - Karma Teml and Robyn Cummings organised an Open Source/Linux session at their local neighbourhood centre in Buchan, Victoria where they presented Linux and Ubuntu to the community - details (and pictures!) available on the <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.com.au/node/84|Ubuntu-AU team website]]</nowiki>
<nowiki>[[File:20110305Buchan.jpg|Karma and Robyn introduce Ubuntu to Buchan]]</nowiki>

===== Social =====
* 2011-01-24 - A group of <nowiki>[[http://lca2011.linux.org.au|linux.conf.au]]</nowiki> attendees all took advantage of having a higher than usual concentration of Ubuntu-AU members in the one city at the same time and got together for a night at the <nowiki>[[http://www.pancakemanor.com.au/|Pancake Manor]]</nowiki> - again details available at the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AustralianTeam/LCA2011Brisbane|LCA2011 Brisbane organisation wiki page]]</nowiki>
* 2011-04-XX - 5 different cities holding release parties for the Natty Narwhal release - photos available on the <nowiki>[[http://www.flickr.com/groups/ubuntuau/|Ubuntu-AU flickr page]]</nowiki>.
** Melbourne - see the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/908/detail/|loco.ubuntu.com event page]]</nowiki>
<nowiki>[[File:NattyMelbourne.jpg|The team at Gloria Jeans coffee in Melbourne]]</nowiki>
** Perth - see the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/948/detail/|loco.ubuntu.com event page]]</nowiki>
** Brisbane - see the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/909/detail/|loco.ubuntu.com event page]]</nowiki>
<nowiki>[[File:NattyBrisbane.jpg|The team at the Pancake Manor in Brisbane]]</nowiki>
** Adelaide - see the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/902/detail/|loco.ubuntu.com event page]]</nowiki>
** Sydney - see the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/883/detail/|loco.ubuntu.com event page]]</nowiki>

===== Other Project Related =====
* 2011-04-02 - The team participated in the Ubuntu Global Jam by holding it's own <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/817/detail/|Translation Jam]]</nowiki> online. This has revived the English Australian translation efforts as a whole.
* Team IRC meetings have now been revived and have been run every month since May 2010. We're constantly working on ways to improve attendance and we're now organising them on the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/teams/ubuntu-au|team loco.ubuntu.com site]]</nowiki>.
* Team Reports started in November 2010 and can be found <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AustralianTeam/TeamReports|on the team wiki page]]</nowiki>.
